Posted By: swords_to_exile (5/4/2012 1:06:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Noel deCordova just came out with a pretty sweet idea for ramping up to this card. This card is a singleton and it's the only non-permanent in the deck. You win because [Abundant Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Abundant Growth) draws you a card and [Laboratory Maniac](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Laboratory Maniac) wins the game for you once you do. The only problem is there's no {U} mana acceleration in the deck and it's hard to win if you draw the Maniac.  
  
EDIT: @ Nonprofitparrot: I said {U} mana acceleration. Even having a Birds of Paradise would be nice but Abundant Growth doesn't accelerate mana because it gives the ability to a land.
posts.html:
Noel deCordova just came out with a pretty sweet idea for ramping up to this card. This card is a singleton and it's the only non-permanent in the deck. You win because Abundant Growth draws you a card and Laboratory Maniac wins the game for you once you do. The only problem is there's no {U} mana acceleration in the deck and it's hard to win if you draw the Maniac.

EDIT: @ Nonprofitparrot: I said {U} mana acceleration. Even having a Birds of Paradise would be nice but Abundant Growth doesn't accelerate mana because it gives the ability to a land.

posts.post_content: This card was broken before it was born, with [Doomsday](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doomsday) + [Shelldock Isle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shelldock Isle) + Laboratory Maniac and your cantripping permanent of choice. You do not HAVE to deck yourself, there is a reason this card states you "may" put it onto the battlefield.

@Nerphice, in fact you will end up with 0 cards in your library if this doesn't hit a non-permanent.
Yes, you may put it onto the battlefield, but if you don't it just stays exiled.

So long as you have something that gives your guys haste, you should destroy them that turn (Concordant Crossroads in Green works).
